creditline: Gift of Henry White Cannon Jr., Class of 1910, in memory of his Father

makers.displaymaker: formerly attributed to Battista da Vicenza, Italian, active ca. 1404–1438
Master of the Bevilacqua Madonna, Italian, died 1412

texts.textentryhtml: Purchased by Jean Paul Richter (1847-1937) from a villa near Verona in January 1911 for Henry White Cannon (1850-1934), Fiesole; by descent to his son, Henry (Harry) W. Cannon, Jr. (1887-1966), Class of 1910; Donated to the Museum in 1935.

bibliography.boilertext: Evelyn Sandberg Vavalà, "A chapter in fourteenth century iconography: Verona", Art bulletin 11, no. 4 (Dec., 1929): p. 376-412.
bibliography.citation: Evelyn Sandberg Vavalà, "A chapter in fourteenth century iconography: Verona", Art bulletin 11, no. 4 (Dec., 1929): p. 376-412., p. 376-412; fig. 14

bibliography.boilertext: Liciso Magagnato, Da Altichiero a Pisanello, (Venezia: Neri Pozza, 1958).
bibliography.citation: Liciso Magagnato, Da Altichiero a Pisanello, (Venezia: Neri Pozza, 1958)., p. 23

bibliography.boilertext: Luigi Coletti, "La mostra 'Da Altichiero a Pisanello'", Arte Veneta, Rivista di Storia dell'Arte 1958, 12 (1959).
bibliography.citation: Luigi Coletti, "La mostra 'Da Altichiero a Pisanello'", Arte Veneta, Rivista di Storia dell'Arte 1958, 12 (1959)., p. 244; p. 246 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: B. B. Fredericksen and F. Zeri, Census of pre-nineteenth-century Italian paintings in North American collections, (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1972).
bibliography.citation: B. B. Fredericksen and F. Zeri, Census of pre-nineteenth-century Italian paintings in North American collections, (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1972)., p. 624

bibliography.boilertext: Jean Paul Richter, A descriptive catalogue of old masters of the Italian school, (Florence: Galileiana, 1907-1914).
bibliography.citation: Jean Paul Richter, A descriptive catalogue of old masters of the Italian school, (Florence: Galileiana, 1907-1914)., no. 37; p. 14-15

bibliography.boilertext: Frank Jewett Mather, Jr., "Veronese primitives in the Cannon Collection", Art in America 24 (1936).
bibliography.citation: Frank Jewett Mather, Jr., "Veronese primitives in the Cannon Collection", Art in America 24 (1936)., p. 52-57; fig. 4

bibliography.boilertext: Jean Paul Richter, The Cannon Collection of italian paintings of the Renaissance: mostly of the Veronese School..., (Princeton, NJ: Princetion University Press, 1936).
bibliography.citation: Jean Paul Richter, The Cannon Collection of italian paintings of the Renaissance: mostly of the Veronese School..., (Princeton, NJ: Princetion University Press, 1936)., no. 10; p. 12-13; fig. 10

geography.displaygeography: Place collected: Europe, Verona, Palazzo Portalupi

caption: Master of the Bevilacqua Madonna (Italian, died 1412), formerly attributed to Battista da Vicenza (Italian, active ca. 1404–1438), Enthroned Madonna. Tempera on poplar wood; 98 x 53 cm, 103 × 60.5 × 7.8 cm (frame). Gift of Henry White Cannon Jr., Class of 1910, in memory of his Father (y1935-22)
